messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] grapes
messages.msgSnippet: Grapes also grow great here in Tracy (San Joaquin Valley). We used to have vines at our previous house, ditto on the spiders and the cure ;), and an additional
messages.messageBody:
Grapes also grow great here in Tracy (San Joaquin Valley). We used to have
vines at our previous house, ditto on the spiders and the cure ;), and an
additional tip is to pick them at night so as to avoid arguing with the
swarms of bees over them!

Pam

----------
From: PSoroosh@...
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] grapes
Date: Mon, Feb 25, 2002, 4:40 PM


> California grapes can be had in season. Organic grapes are very difficult to
> find, are expensive and the ones I get are usually small and sour.

My mom grows organic grapes - they are green, big, sweet and swarming with
spiders <G>. We just take a garden hose to them and spray them, hard, before
picking.

This is in Long Beach, California -- not know as grape country -- but she
must have the ideal spot because she gets huge big wonderful bunches of
great
grapes.



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
